# couchbase-capella_app_endpoint (Resource)

This resource allows you to manage an App Endpoint configuration for a Couchbase Capella App Service.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `app_service_id` (String) The GUID4 ID of the App Service.
- `bucket` (String) The name of the bucket associated with this App Endpoint.
- `cluster_id` (String) The GUID4 ID of the cluster.
- `name` (String) The name of the App Endpoint.
- `organization_id` (String) The GUID4 ID of the organization.
- `project_id` (String) The GUID4 ID of the project.

### Optional

- `cors` (Attributes) CORS configuration for the App Endpoint. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--cors))
- `delta_sync_enabled` (Boolean) If delta sync is enabled for this App Endpoint.
- `oidc` (Attributes List) List of OIDC configurations for the App Endpoint. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--oidc))
- `scopes` (Attributes Map) Configuration for scopes within the App Endpoint. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--scopes))
- `user_xattr_key` (String) The user extended attribute key for the App Endpoint.

### Read-Only

- `admin_url` (String) The admin URL for the App Endpoint.
- `metrics_url` (String) The metrics URL for the App Endpoint.
- `public_url` (String) The public URL for the App Endpoint.
- `require_resync` (Attributes Map) List of collections that require resync, keyed by scope. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--require_resync))
- `state` (String) The current state of the App Endpoint, such as online, offline, resyncing, etc.

<a id="nestedatt--cors"></a>
### Nested Schema for `cors`

Optional:

- `disabled` (Boolean) Disables/Enables CORS for this App Endpoint.
- `headers` (Set of String) List of allowed headers for CORS.
- `login_origin` (Set of String) List of allowed login origins for CORS.
- `max_age` (Number) The maximum age for CORS preflight requests in seconds. Default is 0, which means no caching.
- `origin` (Set of String) List of allowed origins for CORS.


<a id="nestedatt--oidc"></a>
### Nested Schema for `oidc`

Required:

- `client_id` (String) The OpenID Connect provider client ID.
- `issuer` (String) The URL for the OpenID Connect issuer..

Optional:

- `discovery_url` (String) The URL for the non-standard discovery endpoint.
- `register` (Boolean) Indicates whether to register a new App Service user account when a user logs in using OpenID Connect.
- `roles_claim` (String) If set, the value(s) of the given OpenID Connect authentication token claim will be added to the user's roles. The value of this claim in the OIDC token must be either a string or an array of strings, any other type will result in an error.
- `user_prefix` (String) Username prefix for all users created for this provider.
- `username_claim` (String) Allows a different OpenID Connect field to be specified instead of the Subject (sub).

Read-Only:

- `is_default` (Boolean) Indicates whether this is the default OpenID Connect provider for this App Endpoint.
- `provider_id` (String) The GUID4 ID of this OpenID Connect provider. Generated by the backend on creation.


<a id="nestedatt--scopes"></a>
### Nested Schema for `scopes`

Optional:

- `collections` (Attributes Map) Configuration for collections within the App Endpoint. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--scopes--collections))

<a id="nestedatt--scopes--collections"></a>
### Nested Schema for `scopes.collections`

Optional:

- `access_control_function` (String) The Javascript function that is used to specify the access control policies to be applied to documents in this collection.
- `import_filter` (String) The JavaScript function used to filter which documents in the collection that are to be imported by the App Endpoint.



<a id="nestedatt--require_resync"></a>
### Nested Schema for `require_resync`

Read-Only:

- `items` (Set of String) List of collections that require resync.
